{"step_by_step_thinking": "In mandibular primary second molar, the ML (mesiolingual) cusp is usually the largest cusp, while the distobuccal (DB) cusp is usually the smallest. This eliminates options A and C. Option B states that all buccal cusps are of the same size and all lingual cusps are of the same size, which is not true. Therefore, the correct answer is D. All of the above.", "answer_choice": "D"}
